d0gmaz: swap same size as RAM is ok in theory, but you should be careful in case your partitioning programs counts with decimal powers while the RAM size is expressed in binary powers. make it 1.2 times the RAM, to be sure.
well, with sufficient amount of RAM, does that really matter, I have 3GB myself
yes, it may matter, because you may not be able to use hibernation if your swap is less than your RAM
